summary: How much does it cost to get a new medical facility for veterans up and running? The Veterans Health Administration (VHA) spent more than $4 billion staffing and equipping (“activating”) such facilities from fiscal year 2012 through 2018. But VHA doesn’t have a clear definition of allowable activation expenses or a process to estimate total activation costs. Our recommendations address these issues to improve VHA’s...
title: VA Real Property: VHA Should Improve Activation Cost Estimates and Oversight
